content:
As an AI language model, I do not have access to real-time information; but to the best of my knowledge, the impact of redevelopment on local businesses in Hull has been mixed. While some businesses have benefited from increased foot traffic and new customers, others have struggled to compete against larger chains and have been forced to close down.

To support local businesses, the local government in Hull has put in place initiatives to boost the local economy, including:

1. Business Support: The local government has set up business support programs to assist local businesses with growth and sustainability. These programs offer mentorship, training, and funding opportunities to help businesses compete with larger chains.

2. Start-Up Support: The local government has also set up programs to help new businesses get off the ground. These programs offer funding, space, and resources to help entrepreneurs establish themselves in the local market.

3. Local Procurement: The local government has also set a policy to encourage public sector organizations to purchase goods and services from local businesses wherever possible. This policy helps to support local businesses and keep the money circulating in the local economy.

4. Grants: The local government has also set up grant schemes to support small businesses. These grants offer financial assistance to businesses that meet certain criteria, such as hiring local employees or operating sustainably.

Overall, while some local businesses have been negatively impacted by redevelopment, the local government in Hull has implemented various initiatives to support local businesses and boost the local economy.
